table_sample: These and other results from the American Time Use Survey (ATUS) were released today. They include
the average amount of time per day in 2024 that individuals worked, did household activities, and
engaged in leisure and sports activities. Additionally, measures of the average time per day spent
bachelor’s degree or higher performed some work at home on days worked, compared with 18
percent of those with a high school diploma and no college. (See table 6.)
• More people engaged in housework on weekend days than on weekdays, on average—41 percent,
compared with 36 percent. However, people were slightly more likely to do food preparation and
cleanup on weekdays than weekend days—64 percent, compared to 62 percent. (See table 2.)
